alert.note: Alert for Elko; Eureka; Humboldt; Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 16 at 3:07PM PDT until April 16 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko Nevada has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southeastern Humboldt County in northwestern Nevada... Northeastern Lander County in north central Nevada... Southwestern Elko County in northeastern Nevada... Northwestern Eureka County in north central Nevada... * Until 500 PM PDT. * At 300 PM PDT, a dust channel was 12 miles northwest of Elko, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * I-80 in Lander, Eureka, and Southwestern Elko Counties including the Battle Mt area and east toward Carlin. Also, State Route 305 south out of Battle Mt. Locations impacted include... Battle Mountain, Carlin, Valmy, Crescent Valley, Dunphy, Beowawe, Argenta, Emigrant Pass, Palisade, Phoenix Mine, Trenton Canyon Mine, Mule Canyon Reclamation Project, North Area Mine, Emigrant Mine and South Area Mine. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
